author: Fatma Schwarz
title: Denmark bans the sporting of face veils in public
text:
Home » Denmark bans the sporting of face veils in public Denmark bans the sporting of face veils in public May 31, 2018 By Fatma Schwarz Leave a Comment
COPENHAGEN (Reuters) – Denmark has banned the sporting of face veils in public, becoming a member of France and different components of Europe in outlawing the burqa and the niqab worn by some Muslim ladies. Women in niqab exit the viewers seats after the Danish Parliament banned the sporting of face veils in public, at Christiansborg Palace in Copenhagen, Denmark, May 31, 2018. Ritzau Scanpix/Mads Claus Rasmussen/by way of REUTERS
Parliament voted on Thursday for the legislation proposed by the centre-right authorities which stated face veils had been opposite to Danish values. Opponents say the ban, that comes into impact on Aug, 1 infringes ladies’s proper to decorate as they select.
Justice Minister Soren Pape Poulsen stated police wouldn’t order offenders to take away their veils, however would effective them and inform them to go house. Women in niqab are pictured after the Danish Parliament banned the sporting of face veils in public, at Christiansborg Palace in Copenhagen, Denmark, May 31, 2018. Ritzau Scanpix/Mads Claus Rasmussen/by way of REUTERS
Fines will vary from 1,000 Danish crowns ($160) for a primary offence to 10,000 crowns for the fourth violation. gtag('config', 'UA-114047264-2'); Slideshow (4 Images)
France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Bulgaria and the German state of Bavaria have all imposed some restrictions on full-face veils in public locations.
Justice Minister Pape Poulsen, head of the conservative celebration in a authorities backed by the nationalist Danish People’s Party, stated when the invoice was proposed in February: “It is incompatible with the values ​​of the Danish society or the respect for the community to keep the face hidden when meeting each other in the public space.”
Zainab Ibn Hssain, who lives in Copenhagen and has been sporting the niqab for the final yr, informed Reuters: “It’s not good. It will imply that I received’t have the ability to go to high school, go to work or exit with my household.
“But I received’t take my niqab off so I’ve to seek out one other answer,” the 20 year-old added.
Human rights group Amnesty International referred to as the ban “a discriminatory violation of women’s rights”.
“All women should be free to dress as they please and to wear clothing that expresses their identity or beliefs,” it stated.
